title.narrative: EMERGENCY COORDINATION, ZONE OFFICES, GENDER

description.narrative: By end 2022, UNICEF staff and partners use the appropriate tools, strategies and resources to plan, implement, coordinate and effectively monitor the implementation and programmatic integration of emergency responses, which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews (Covid), Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Unicef Capacity For Programming On Gender. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2022, the country programme is effectively designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards to achieve the best results for children in Chad.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2022, UNICEF staff and partners use the appropriate tools, strategies and resources to plan, implement, coordinate andeffectively monitor the implementation and programmatic integration of emergency responses

description.narrative: In the face of rapid onset and protracted humanitarian crises—conflict-induced displacements, destructive rains, floods, epidemics and malnutrition, exacerbated by COVID-19, UNICEF responded to larger needs in 2021 through a multi-sectoral and gender-sensitive strategy, including disease outbreak prevention and control; early detection and quality treatment of children with SAM; distance/school-based learning; capacity-building for care provision, referrals and psychosocial support.UNICEF maintained its strong partnerships with governments and CSOs for programme implementation aligned with its core values and CCC, strengthened coordination of emergency preparedness and response through cluster facilitation and contributed to inter-agency planning and implementation (HNO and HRP). | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:21/01/2022
